name: Interesting Records in the NBA Quiz | Sports | 5 Questions

questions.text: Who set a record for an NBA playoff series, by scoring more than 50 points in consecutive games in 1988?
questions.explanation:
Michael Jordan.

	Michael Jordan scored 50 and 55 in Games 1 and 2 against the Cavaliers, April 28 and May 1, 1988.

questions.text: Who was the first player to score 100 points in a single game?
questions.explanation:
Wilt Chamberlain.

	Wilt Chamberlain scored 100 points for Philadelphia. He averaged 50.1 ppg that season in 1962.

questions.text: Upon retirement, which of the following was the NBA scoring leader?
questions.explanation:
Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

	Kareem of the Milwaukee Bucs and Los Angeles Lakers, retired with the career scoring lead.  He graduated from UCLA.

questions.text: What team led the league in opponents scoring (lowest ppg allowed) for the 2002-03 season?
questions.explanation:
Pistons.

	The Pistons defense is led by a two-time NBA defensive player of the year Ben Wallace. The Pistons allowed a league low 86.7 points per game. Their point differential was a positive 6.3. They went 50-32 for the second straight year. However after the season they fired coached Rick Carlisle, in favoe of Larry Brown.

questions.text: Who was the first player to record a triple double in a NBA all-star game?
questions.explanation:
Michael Jordan.

	MJ did this in the 97-98 season, While on his way to the trifecta of an NBA Regular Season MVP, All-star MVP and NBA Finals MVP all in the same year.
